title: Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist
content:
The Monitoring and Evaluation Specialist will play a critical role in ensuring the effectiveness and impact of a program's initiatives aimed at combating terrorism and other transnational criminal activities. This role is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing monitoring and evaluation (M&E) systems, collecting and analyzing data, and providing actionable insights to enhance the program's performance and outcomes. The specialist will work closely with program stakeholders, partners, and beneficiaries to ensure that the program's objectives are met and its impact is maximized.
What you will do:

Develop and Implement M&E Framework:

Design and implement a comprehensive monitoring and evaluation framework that aligns with the program's goals and objectives.
Define clear performance indicators, targets, and data collection methods for assessing program effectiveness.


Data Collection and Analysis:

Design and oversee data collection processes to gather relevant information on program activities, outputs, and outcomes.
Collect, compile, and analyze data from various sources to assess the program's impact and identify trends and patterns.
Apply statistical methods and data visualization techniques to present findings effectively.


Performance Assessment:

Conduct regular assessments to measure the program's performance against established indicators and targets.
Identify gaps, challenges, and areas for improvement in program implementation and recommend corrective actions.


Reporting and Documentation:

Prepare regular and ad hoc reports on program performance, utilizing data-driven insights to highlight achievements and areas needing attention.
Maintain comprehensive records of M&E activities, methodologies, and findings for accountability and future reference.


Stakeholder Collaboration:

Collaborate closely with program managers, partners, and relevant stakeholders to ensure that M&E efforts align with program priorities.
Participate in meetings and workshops to share insights and contribute to strategic planning discussions.


Capacity Building

Provide training and guidance to program staff, partners, and beneficiaries on M&E methodologies and best practices.
Foster a culture of learning and continuous improvement within the program.


Learning and Adaptation:

Regularly review M&E findings and feedback to inform program adjustments and adaptations.
Propose innovative solutions based on M&E insights to enhance program impact and outcomes.



What you will need:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., International Development, Social Sciences, Statistics).
Proven experience (5+ years) in designing and implementing M&E systems, preferably in international development, security, or counterterrorism programs.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent communication and report-writing skills to effectively convey complex information to various stakeholders.
Knowledge of security, law enforcement, and international affairs is desirable.
Proficiency in using M&E software and tools.
Ability to work independently, collaborate effectively in a team, and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and a commitment to quality.

Clearance/Citizenship

Active TS/SCI required

If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request reasonable workplace accommodation for any part of our employment process, please send an email to accomodations@twosixtech.com. Information provided will be kept confidential and used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.
Additionally, please be advised that this business uses E-Verify in its hiring practices.
